title: 110_hr3948
content: The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" establishes a temporary Iraq War surtax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax for the taxable year 2008. Joint returns will see an increase in tax liability based on a surtax determined by a specific table. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax for the taxable year 2008. The surtax is based on a specific table, with varying rates depending on the net income tax liability. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax for the taxable year 2008. For individuals, trusts, and estates with net income tax liability, the tax imposed under this chapter shall be increased by the amount of the surtax determined in accordance with a specific table. The "Share the Sacrifice Act of 2007" introduces a temporary Iraq War surtax for the taxable year 2008. The surtax rates are as follows: 2.5% for net income tax liability not over $5,300, $132.50 plus 5% for liability over $5,300 but not over $11,300, $432.50 plus 11% for liability over $11,300 but not over $18,200, and $1,191.50 plus 16% for liability over $18,200. The tax imposed on corporations with net income tax liability is increased by 16 percent. Certain exceptions related to military service exempt members of the Armed Forces who received excludible compensation from gross income. Individuals who received excludible combat zone compensation or death gratuity under certain conditions are exempt from increased corporate taxes. Individuals who died on or after September 11, 2001, and before the end of the taxable year may be exempt from increased taxes. Joint returns are treated based on the description of either spouse. There is an exception for individuals with adjusted gross income not exceeding $30,000. Net Income Tax Liability is defined for this purpose. Net Income Tax Liability is defined as the excess of regular tax liability and tax imposed by section 55, minus credits allowed under part IV. The tax imposed under this part is not considered tax imposed by this chapter for certain purposes. (b) Clerical Amendment.--The table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code is amended by adding a new item at the end. Part VIII. Temporary Iraq War Surtax. The amendments apply to taxable years after December 31, 2007 and do not change tax rates for section 15 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
